intro: Griffithella pierrei, commonly known as the Cape Peninsula sandburs, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal sand dunes and rocky areas, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its small, spiny fruits are adapted for wind dispersal, aiding in its propagation across sandy environments. Griffithella pierrei is a hardy, drought-tolerant species that plays a role in stabilizing coastal ecosystems.
